nodes.text: Congratulations, you have successfully made it to the end of the semester. Most of you have mastered the principles of being a Rogue.

I shall be calling upon each of you in turn to speak about your experiences over the course of this semester. What was the most important lesson you have learned? What symbol of this semester did you bring and why?
And, finally, who do you believe has proved him or herself to be the "Rogue of the Year."
Fr√§ulein Esme, you may begin.
I did not come here to be hero or Rogue. I came here because I did not vant to be an aimless nomad surrounded by uncertainty and fear. I vanted to find home, family, and to feel safe.
But I did not find home here. I did not find someone to protect me. I do not feel safe here. I have learned that danger is everyvere.
I have learned that the only vay to deal vith uncertainty and fear is to face it. To stand up to danger. To be a Hero.
I bring Varrior Drat tail to class. Is to show how Thomas and I defeated Queen Drat and stopped Drat invasion. Ve are heroes. Ve are Rogues.
There is one person who clearly von the title of "Rogue of the Year." The avard should go to Thomas.
I bring Proach claw to class. It is symbol of fight Shawn and I have against Giant Proach. Ve use sneaky skills as vell as combat to take Giant Proach down.
I think that Thomas is "Rogue of Year." Thomas has done more for people than anyone else.
I think Shawn has earned "Rogue of Year." He has helped more people and done more hero things than anyone else.
I bring in Lockpick as my symbol of being Rogue. Before I come here, I vas not proud of things that I could do. I looked down on my sneaky skills and vat I vas.
Now, I am proud to be Rover. I am proud of being Rogue.
I feel Thomas is best Rogue. Thomas should be "Rogue of Year."
Of all peoples in this class, Shawn deserves most to be "Rogue of Year."
Very good, Fr√§ulein. I am proud that you have been part of this class. You make a fine Rogue.
Fr√§ulein MacMichael, will you please tell what you have learned, of what are you most proud, and who should be the "Rogue of the Year?"
I brought in a gold doubloon. It was pirate booty and I recovered it from the lost treasure in the Sea Caves.
It took all of the skills that I learned here in class to find it.
Of course, I couldn't have gotten the treasure without the help of Shawn. He solved many of the puzzles and did what was needed to get to the treasure.
That's why I think Shawn O'Conner should be "Rogue of the Year."
It took a real Rogue to recover that lost pirate treasure. That's why I should be "Rogue of the Year."
You are indeed an exemplary Rogue, Fr√§ulein.
And now, Herr Kent... You may answer the questions.
I've learned a great deal this semester. I came here to become a hero and I've learned more about heroism than I ever imagined.
I brought the "Medal of Honor" my father earned when he saved Sardonia. It has always been an inspiration to me to do my best.
What I have learned most in this class is that anyone can be a hero. Heroism is not about who or what you are - it's about what you do.
And I learned that I am proud to be a Rogue.
I feel that the "Rogue of the Year" title should go to Esme. She's overcome more than anyone else in this class. She's saved the school from the Warrior Drats. She's proved herself to be a true hero.
I feel that the "Rogue of the Year" title should go to Shawn. He's the true hero of the class.
Sehr gut, Herr Kent. Of all the students in this classroom, you have learned and accomplished more than most of the others. I applaud your accomplishments.
Und now, Herr Kyro - what lessons have you learned in this class?

I must confess that I came to this school under false pretenses. I considered Rogues to be jokes and Heroes to be gullible fools. I was here only to accomplish what my father could not - to find the Raven.
Over the course of this semester, I learned that I cannot allow myself to be another person's patsy. I must stand on my own and not in the shadow of another.
And I learned that there really is such a thing as a hero.
And so, I have nothing to show for the lessons I have learned here... Nothing, that is, but the fact that I still live.
Thus, I believe that Shawn O'Conner deserves to be "Rogue of the Year." There is no finer Rogue than he.
You have learned very important lessons here. May they serve you well in your future, Herr Kyro.
Herr Caesari, what do you have to show for your accomplishments in this class?
This class has been the best experience of my life, sir. I have learned a great deal from your teachings. Thank you for making my life richer as a Rogue Hero.
As a symbol of all I have accomplished here, I brought in the university handbook. I will devote my life to the ideals that this school represents.
And I believe that I deserve to be the "Rogue of the Year." There is no one else as accomplished as I.
Indeed?
Finally, we come to Herr O'Conner. What have you accomplished by being here?

options.text: Say Something Heroic

nodes.text: I learned that life is a series of choices. Those decisions we make not only affect our future, but the future of everyone around us. Real heroism isn't about glory or battle, but about creating a better future for others.
And I've learned that I can be a hero. It's all up to me.

options.text: Say Something Inspiring About Friendship

nodes.text: I've learned the importance of friendship. I could never have done the things I did without the help of others.
My life is so much better because of all the great friends I have met at this school.

options.text: Say Something Snarky About the School

nodes.text: So what did I learn at this Hero University?

Esme came to the school to get away from her family. Katie came here to find pirate treasure. Thomas came here to get a dead father's approval. Kyro came here to find the Raven. Why Sosi came here, I don't know - but I'm sure it wasn't out of the goodness of his heart.
Not one of us came to this school to actually be a Hero. So much for this being a school for Heroes.

options.text: Show Off the Raven Statue

nodes.text: This is my symbol of what I learned this semester at Hero University - the Raven.

options.text: Talk About Your History

nodes.text: I learned things about my father and uncle that I never imagined before coming here.

options.text: Say Something Proud About Your Father

nodes.text: My father was once The Raven of Thieves here in Sardonia. He ruled over every petty crook, swindler, and robber simply because he had this statue.
Then one day, he realized that what he was doing was wrong. He didn't want to be a thief. He didn't want to be responsible for all the pain and unhappiness thieves cause in this world.
He decided to become a Rogue and teach his followers to be Rogues, too.
He died trying to be a Hero and change the world for the better.
So now, it's up to me to carry out my father's dying wish. I am a Rogue and I will be a Hero.

options.text: Say Something Cynical About Your Family

nodes.text: This Raven belonged to my father. He was The Raven of Thieves in Sardonia. My uncle is the Chief Thief of the Con Games Guild.
I was just following in my father's footsteps when I wanted to become a Thief.

options.text: Talk About the Raven

nodes.text: This Raven statue could be used to unite all the Thieves of Sardonia under one leader - the person who holds this statue.

options.text: Claim Your Inheritance as King of Thieves

nodes.text: With all the skills I've learned in this class - stealth, tool use, perception, and deception, I found this Raven and obtained it for myself.
I will be The Raven of Thieves in Sardonia!

options.text: Claim Your Place as a Rogue

nodes.text: This Raven destroyed my father and my family. It's a symbol of greed, envy, petty cruelty, and selfishness. Once upon a time, I'd be proud to have this Raven. Now I'm sad and ashamed of the grief it caused.
I've learned a lot here about who I am - and what I want to do with my life. I want friends, family, and a better future for everyone.
I want to be a Rogue!

options.text: Give the Raven to Gerhard

nodes.text: Master, I'd like you to keep the Raven. I know that you will use it wisely and well.

options.text: Give the Raven to Joel

nodes.text: Joel, I'd like you to have this statue. I know how important this is to you. Use it wisely.

options.text: Keep the Raven

nodes.text: This statue will continue to remind me of my past - and what I want to be in the future.
But I will never use it to become a Thief, and I will not let anyone else use it that way either.

options.text: Show Off the Lucky Coin

nodes.text: This Lucky Coin was once my father's. It's a symbol of who I was and what I will be. It was a key to unlocking my past and giving me a new future.
I could become a Thief like my father and uncle. However, with a flip of the coin, I could be a Rogue like the rest of you.
<flips the coin> Ah - Heads! Guess that means that I am a Rogue.
Wait... that coin came up tails!
Well, that only proves that I'm a Rogue, doesn't it?

options.text: Don't Show Anything

nodes.text: I didn't bring anything to class to show off what I've done in class this semester. The fact that I'm even sitting here is a symbol. It was my choice to be here.

options.text: Nominate Esme for Rogue of the Year

nodes.text: I think that Esme should be Rogue of the Year. She's brave, sneaky, and very skilled at keeping secrets.

options.text: Nominate Katie for Rogue of the Year

nodes.text: I think that Katie should be Rogue of the Year. She used the skills she learned in class to outwit and evade sea monsters, Gogs, and Zombies to accomplish something no one else has - retrieve the pirate treasure of the Sea Caves.

options.text: Nominate Thomas for Rogue of the Year

nodes.text: I think that Thomas should be Rogue of the Year. No one else had more to learn from this class, and no one else put that knowledge to better use.

options.text: Nominate Kyro for Rogue of the Year

nodes.text: I think that Joel should be Rogue of the Year. He's gotten away with more sneaky stuff here at the school than anyone else.

options.text: Nominate Sosi for Rogue of the Year

nodes.text: Caesari is the most devious, deceitful, and dastardly person in this class. He clearly deserves to be Rogue of the Year.
Wait - did I say Rogue? I mean to say Villain of the Year.

options.text: Nominate Shawn for Rogue of the Year

nodes.text: I think that I should be Rogue of the Year. I've used my skills and wits to do more than anyone else in this class - and I did it with pizzazz!
Herr O'Conner, it has been a unique experience having you in this class. May you accomplish your goals in life.
Wait... What? Thomas is awesome and all that, but...
Shouldn't I be Rogue of the Year?
All that work, then I go and fail the final exam. It's a shame real life isn't like a game. If it was, I could just go back and take the test again.
Well, it was my choice. I'd rather be a King among Thieves than just one more student, even a champion student.
Assuming, of course, that I can hold onto that statue long enough to become the King. Every Thief in Sardonia will want to take it from me.
And my uncle will probably be pretty angry at me, so he'll probably do his best to get the Raven back.
Then there's the little problem that I have no idea what a Thieves' Guild is really like, let alone run one.
But other than those minor details, I will be the King of Thieves in Sardonia!
Maybe I could have been the one to catch the school thief.
I'm sure I could have killed the Giant Proach if I'd found the time.
I was probably supposed to SAVE Kyro, not be haunted by his ghost.
Maybe I could have ended the Drat Invasion.
I knew coming in that my skills were weak, but they didn't have to stay that way. I could have worked as hard as Thomas to raise my skills.
So, okay, I made a few mistakes and bad decisions. Maybe I could have done more for my friends. Maybe I shouldn't have made enemies of Sosi...
Nah... I'm good with having Sosi for an enemy. That part's fine.
I'm sure we can do better the next time. There has to be a next time!

The one line Shawn will remember -
"I could have been a contender."
But the game is over and Shawn is glum,
So play again until you've won.

Shawn thought school was not his thing -
Why be a student when you can be king?
But the truth is cruel when you have the Raven -
There's no such place as a safe haven.

And Shawn will soon be surrounded by crooks
Who watch him with greedy and murderous looks
The world will need heroes and it will need Shawn,
But by that time, Shawn will be gone.
RIP
Now, we will come to the presentation of the title and prize of "Rogue of the Year."
You have all made your opinions on the matter clear. The prize will be awarded to the one who has clearly learned, accomplished, and demonstrated the traits of a true Rogue.
Two of you started out with very little in the way of Rogue skills, but have worked hard throughout the semester to improve those talents.
I am awarding extra credit for extreme dedication and hard work to Thomas Kent and Shawn O'Conner.
One student in this class started out with almost no skills useful to a Rogue, and perhaps did not wish to be in this class.
However, thanks to hard work and ceaseless dedication, Thomas Kent is now as worthy a Rogue as any of you. As a result, I have chosen to give extra credit to Herr Kent in this competition.
Some of you proved to be more than just Rogues. Some of you proved to be true heroes.
Herr O'Conner risked his own life and soul to rescue Herr Kyro from a lonely death in the Catacombs.
Herr Kyro, in turn, saved Herr O'Conner's life in much the same situation. They are both to be commended.
Fr√§ulein Esme saved Herr O'Conner from the perils of the Wine Cellar. Very well done.
Fr√§ulein MacMichael saved Herr O'Conner from certain death in the Sea Caves, proving her courage and resourcefulness.
Herr Kent rescued the critically Herr O'Conner from the extremely dangerous Catacombs. It was truly heroic of him.
It seems, Herr O'Conner, that you have been in need of rescue more than once. You are extremely fortunate that this is a school for Heroes, and that there are so many Heroes in this classroom.
Sadly, Herr O'Conner has disqualified himself from the competition through his choices.
He is clearly more of a Thief than he is a Rogue.
Und so, the title and award for "Rogue of the Year" goes to...
Herr Thomas Kent.
The student that most deserves the Rogue of the Year title is Shawn O'Conner. He has clearly demonstrated the skills, smarts, and actions that define a Rogue. He is a Hero of this university.

nodes.message: TODO: Replace with a vignette showing everyone except Joel?

nodes.text: Herr O'Conner, what words of inspiration and encouragement would you make to your fellow students?

options.text: Say Something Witty

nodes.text: Before I came here, I was wandering through life without a goal or a path. When I arrived at this school, I didn't know what a Rogue was and I didn't believe in Heroes. I had no idea that Hero-U would be my Rogue to Redemption.
Life is what we make of it - so let's all make the most of it!

options.text: Say Something Inspiring

nodes.text: Before I came here, I was pretty much on my own. I had no real friends. I had no real goals.
Then one day, I was dragged to this school. I didn't want to be here. I figured that I would just try to get by and look for a chance to escape this college castle.
But despite everything, I started learning interesting and useful things. I started thinking about other people besides myself. I started caring about friends and family.

Every person in this class taught me about myself and who I wanted to be. We've shared laughter and fear; we've accomplished more than any of us dreamed. I would not be Rogue of the Year without the help of all of you.
Thank you, all of you, for all you've taught me. Thank you for awarding me this honor. I'm very proud that I am Rogue of the Year.
Above all, I'm proud to be a Rogue.

options.text: Say Something Loving

nodes.text: I've learned many things at this school, but above all, I've learned the importance of love.

options.text: Talk About Shawn's Love for Esme

nodes.text: The one person who taught me most about love was Esme. She has a passionate spirit that is wild and wonderful. She is fearless and strong - and full of surprises. She's a perfect Rogue!
What do you mean - Esme taught you about love? You told me that you loved me!
Wait - I thought you were in love with me?
You have been playing around with Esme on the side? I thought I was the one that you loved!
Hey - what can I say? I really am a Rogue!
You certainly deserve to be Rogue of Year! No one has done more than You.
Actually, the best Rogue feat I did at Hero-U was not even mentioned in class.
Vot vas that?
I stole your heart!

options.text: Talk About Shawn's Love for Katie

nodes.text: The person who most inspired me this year is Katie. She came to this school determined to prove that she could do anything she set out to do.
Despite danger, deceit, and near-disaster, she accomplished her goal.
Hey, you helped a bit.
I'm very proud that I won Rogue of the Year, but I'm even prouder that I won Katie's heart.
Hey - you are MY boyfriend. Vhy are you talking about Katie? You told me that you loved me!
Wait - I thought you were in love with me?
You have been playing around with Miss MacMichael on the side? I thought I was the one that you loved!
Hey - what can I say? I really am a Rogue!
So you think you won my heart, do you? Like I'm some sort of a prize in a treasure chest...
Well, of all the gold and riches we have found, your love is the thing I'll treasure most.
You really are a Rogue, Shawn.

options.text: Talk About Shawn's Love for Thomas

nodes.text: The person who taught me what it really means to be a hero is Thomas. Thomas had no Rogue skills before coming to the school. Thomas never wanted to be a Rogue.
But Thomas has worked harder than anyone else to master Rogue skills. Thomas believes that you do whatever you can to make the world a better place.
Thomas told me that everything we do can make a difference in someone else's life. Thomas taught me that I really want to be a Hero.
Hey - you are MY boyfriend. Vhy are you talking about Thomas? You told me that you loved me!
What's all this Thomas stuff? What about me? I'm the one you said you loved!
You have been playing around with Thomas on the side? I thought I was the one that you loved!
Hey - what can I say? I really am a Rogue!
I'm glad to see that the mustache and beard look just as silly on you as they did on me.
Ah, and here I thought I looked suave and sophisticated!
Those things you said in class about me... they were the sweetest things anyone's ever said to me.
Don't worry - I have many more sweet things to say to you. I just want to whisper them into your ear while we cuddle.
Oh, Shawn, you really are a Rogue!

options.text: Talk About Shawn's Love for Joel

nodes.text: The person who taught me best what a Rogue can be is Joel.
Joel knows more ways to connive, contrive, and just plain con his way at this school. He comes across as a meek little guy that nobody really notices, but he's the most skilled Rogue in this class.
So the moral is that I may have won the Rogue of the Year prize, but I'm not the best Rogue. Joel is the one who deserves that title.
Hey - you are MY boyfriend. Vhy are you talking about Joel? You told me that you loved me!
What's all this Joel stuff? What about me? I'm the one you said you loved!
Wait - I thought you were in love with me?
Hey - what can I say? I really am a Rogue!
After all the things that you have done at this school, why do you believe that I am a better Rogue than you? You were the one who saved my life.
I know you are the best Rogue. You stole something from me and I never realized it until now.
You stole my heart.

options.text: Talk About Shawn's Love for Aeolus

nodes.text: Love is what drives us to greatness. It's the passion we feel for what we love and what we believe in that makes us strive to do something meaningful with our lives.
My friend Aeolus has taught me the power of music and song. Music inspires us. It keeps us going through the dark moments of our life. It makes the good times better.
Love gives us hope and music gives us joy. Together, they make us all want to be heroes.
Hey - you are MY boyfriend. Vhy are you talking about Aeolus? You told me that you loved me!
What's all this Aeolus stuff? What about me? I'm the one you said you loved!
Wait - I thought you were in love with me?
You have been playing around with Aeolus on the side? I thought I was the one that you loved!
Hey - what can I say? I really am a Rogue!
Do you know what's the best part of playing with you?
We make beautiful music together?
Hey, I went to a lot of treble to bass my final joke on that line, and you beat me to it!

options.text: Talk About Shawn's Love for Sosi

nodes.text: There's no one in this classroom who has taught me more about the love for my fellow man than the person who has touched the lives of everyone around him - Caesari Sosi!
I know that everyone in this class will never forget Caesari.
Esme can attest to Caesari's gentlemanly behavior.
Katie can affirm that Sosi is a polite Sportsman when it comes to games of Poobah.
And, of course, Joel can confirm Caesari's courage and self-sacrifice in the face of danger.
Or Joel could, if he were still alive...
So here's to Sosi - It's because of people like him that the world needs Heroes like me!

options.text: Say Something Snarky

nodes.text: Thank you, thank you, thank you for this lovely award for a class that doesn't exist at a school that disavows any knowledge of our actions.
The main thing I've learned from all this Is:

You can sneak and steal behind the scenes,
As long as the ends justify the means,
It doesn't matter what you do
At this school called Hero-U.

nodes.message: Shawn killed Giant Proach (with or without Esme)
Shawn defeated or negotiated with the Queen Drat
Shawn saved Joel from the Wraith
Shawn has at least five skills at 80+
Shawn needs 5 skills at 80+ to get "skillful" points towards ROTY
